name: GetWorkerPeriod
description:
Get the eligible period for a worker on a specific date.

Fetches the work period from the period schedule for a specified worker on a given date or defaults to today's date if none is provided. Useful for checking a worker's eligibility in a period schedule.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: The unique Workday ID identifying the resource. Provide this ID to specify the worker whose period eligibility is being queried.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: worker_eligibility_date
parameters.description: The date to check worker eligibility, using the yyyy-mm-dd format. Defaults to today if not provided.

value_schema.description: The date on which the worker is eligible, using the yyyy-mm-dd format. If date isn't given it will default to the current Date.

parameters.name: max_response_objects
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to return in a single response. Default is 20; maximum is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: response_offset_index
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object to return in the collection. Defaults to 0. Used with 'limit' for paging.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.
